hero.title: Our Social Impact
hero.subtitle: Transforming lives through film education and empowerment

intro.title: Creating Lasting Change
intro.description: As a social enterprise, MEB CBC channels income from commercial film production into practical training initiatives for youth and women, creating social impact while building a sustainable creative ecosystem.

focusAreas.title: Youth Empowerment
focusAreas.description: Providing young Rwandans aged 18-35 with professional skills and career pathways in the creative industry. Priority given to those from underserved communities with limited access to such opportunities.
points: Free foundation courses for disadvantaged youth

focusAreas.title: Women in Film
focusAreas.description: Breaking down barriers for women in Rwanda's film industry through targeted training, mentorship, and opportunities. Currently 65% of our participants are women.

focusAreas.title: Job Creation
focusAreas.description: Building sustainable livelihoods through direct employment, freelance opportunities, and entrepreneurship support in the creative sector.

focusAreas.title: Industry Development
focusAreas.description: Contributing to the growth and professionalization of Rwanda's media and creative industry through quality training and international partnerships.

stories.title: From Unemployed to Film Producer
stories.quote: I had no job prospects after finishing school. MEB CBC's training gave me real skills. Now I run my own video production company and employ three other people.
stories.author: Marie Uwase, 28

stories.title: Breaking Barriers as a Female Cinematographer
stories.quote: People said cameras were 'men's work.' MEB CBC believed in me. Today, I'm the lead camera operator on major international productions filming in Rwanda.
stories.author: Divine Mukamazimpaka, 26

stories.title: Rural Youth to Animation Studio Founder
stories.quote: Coming from a village, I never imagined I could work in animation. The free training changed my life. I now create animations that tell our Rwandan stories.
stories.author: Jean-Paul Niyonzima, 24
stories.role: Animator | Started Animation Studio in Musanze
